Back.name: Cable Seated Row (Underhand)
Back.desc:
Hypertrophy: 3-4 Sets / 8-10 Reps
Strength: 3-4 Sets / 4-6 Reps (Heavy)

1) Sit slightly forward on seat or bench in order to grasp cable attachment

2) With an underhand grip, pull cable attachment to waist while straightening lower back

3) Pull shoulders back and push chest forward while arching back

4) Return until arms are extended, shoulders are stretched forward, and lower back is flexed forward

5) Repeat

Back.name: Cable Seated Row
Back.desc:
Hypertrophy: 3-4 Sets / 8-10 Reps
Strength: 3-4 Sets / 4-6 Reps (Heavy)

1) Sit slightly forward on seat or bench in order to grasp cable attachment

2) With a close grip, pull cable attachment to waist while straightening lower back

3) Pull shoulders back and push chest forward while arching back

4) Return until arms are extended, shoulders are stretched forward, and lower back is flexed forward

5) Repeat

Back.name: Cable Seated Row (Wide)
Back.desc:
Hypertrophy: 3-4 Sets / 8-10 Reps
Strength: 3-4 Sets / 4-6 Reps (Heavy)

1) Sit slightly forward on seat or bench in order to grasp cable attachment

2) With a wide grip, pull cable attachment to waist while straightening lower back

3) Pull shoulders back and push chest forward while arching back

4) Return until arms are extended, shoulders are stretched forward, and lower back is flexed forward

5) Repeat

Back.name: Bent Over Row (Dumbbell)
Back.desc:
Hypertrophy: 3-4 Sets / 8-10 Reps
Strength: 3-4 Sets / 4-6 Reps (Heavy)

1)Bend your knees slightly and bend over the dumbbells with your back straight

2) Grasp each dumbbell with an overhand grip so they are horizontal and inline with your feet

3) Pull the dumbbells to your upper waist while keeping the dumbbells close to your body

4) In a controlled manner, return to the starting position where arms are extended and shoulders are stretched downward

5) Repeat

Back.name: Bent Over Row (Underhand)
Back.desc:
Hypertrophy: 3-4 Sets / 8-10 Reps
Strength: 3-4 Sets / 4-6 Reps (Heavy)

1)Bend your knees slightly and bend over the bar with your back straight

2) Grasp the bar with an underhand grip

3) Pull the bar to your upper waist while keeping the bar close to your body

4) In a controlled manner, return to the starting position where arms are extended and shoulders are stretched downward

5) Repeat

Back.name: Bent Over Row
Back.desc:
Hypertrophy: 3-4 Sets / 8-10 Reps
Strength: 3-4 Sets / 4-6 Reps (Heavy)

1)Bend your knees slightly and bend over the bar with your back straight

2) Grasp the bar with an overhand grip

3) Pull the bar to your upper waist while keeping the bar close to your body

4) In a controlled manner, return to the starting position where arms are extended and shoulders are stretched downward

5) Repeat

Back.name: Deadlift (Dumbbell)
Back.desc:
Hypertrophy: 3-4 Sets / 8-10 Reps
Strength: 3-4 Sets / 4-6 Reps (Heavy)

1) Grab a pair of dumbbells of an appropriate amount of weight and place them on the floor infront of you

2) Stand shoulder width apart and bend the dumbbells, placing your hands on the bar with an overhand grip (dumbbells should be on their side)

3) Make sure your back is straight and your chest is up

4) Pull the weight up off the ground, thrusting forward at full extension

5) Lower weight back down keeping the dumbbells as close to you as possible

6) Repeat

Back.name: Deadlift (Mixed)
Back.desc:
Hypertrophy: 3-4 Sets / 8-10 Reps
Strength: 3-4 Sets / 4-6 Reps (Heavy)

1) Load a barbell with an appropriate amount of weight and place it on the floor infront of you

2) Stand shoulder width apart and bend over and place your hands on the bar with mixed grip

3) Make sure your back is straight and your chest is up

4) Pull the weight up off the ground, thrusting the bar once at full extension

5) Lower weight back down keeping the bar as close to you as possible

6) Repeat

Back.name: Deadlift
Back.desc:
Hypertrophy: 3-4 Sets / 8-10 Reps
Strength: 3-4 Sets / 4-6 Reps (Heavy)

1) Load a barbell with an appropriate amount of weight and place it on the floor infront of you

2) Stand shoulder width apart and bend over and place your hands on the bar with an overhand grip

3) Make sure your back is straight and your chest is up

4) Pull the weight up off the ground, thrusting the bar once at full extension

5) Lower weight back down keeping the bar as close to you as possible

6) Repeat

Back.name: Sumo Deadlift (Mixed)
Back.desc:
Hypertrophy: 3-4 Sets / 8-10 Reps
Strength: 3-4 Sets / 4-6 Reps (Heavy)

1) Load a barbell with an appropriate amount of weight and place it on the floor infront of you

2) Stand with a wide stance (past shoulder length) and bend over and place your hands on the bar with a mixed grip

3) Make sure your back is straight and your chest is up

4) Pull the weight up off the ground, thrusting the bar once at full extension

5) Lower weight back down keeping the bar as close to you as possible

6) Repeat

Back.name: Sumo Deadlift
Back.desc:
Hypertrophy: 3-4 Sets / 8-10 Reps
Strength: 3-4 Sets / 4-6 Reps (Heavy)

1) Load a barbell with an appropriate amount of weight and place it on the floor infront of you

2) Stand with a wide stance (past shoulder length) and bend over and place your hands on the bar with an overhand grip

3) Make sure your back is straight and your chest is up

4) Pull the weight up off the ground, thrusting the bar once at full extension

5) Lower weight back down keeping the bar as close to you as possible

6) Repeat

Back.name: Straight Leg Deadlift (Mixed)
Back.desc:
Hypertrophy: 3-4 Sets / 8-10 Reps
Strength: 3-4 Sets / 4-6 Reps (Heavy)

1) Load a barbell with an appropriate amount of weight and place it on the floor infront of you

2) Stand with a close stance (inside shoulder length) and bend over and place your hands on the bar with a mixed grip

3) Make sure your back is straight and your chest is up

4) Pull the weight up off the ground, thrusting the bar once at full extension

5) Lower weight back down keeping the bar as close to you as possible

6) Do this while keeping your legs as straight as possible

7) Repeat

Back.name: Straight Leg Deadlift
Back.desc:
Hypertrophy: 3-4 Sets / 8-10 Reps
Strength: 3-4 Sets / 4-6 Reps (Heavy)

1) Load a barbell with an appropriate amount of weight and place it on the floor infront of you

2) Stand with a close stance (inside shoulder length) and bend over and place your hands on the bar with an overhand grip

3) Make sure your back is straight and your chest is up

4) Pull the weight up off the ground, thrusting the bar once at full extension

5) Lower weight back down keeping the bar as close to you as possible

6) Do this while keeping your legs as straight as possible

7) Repeat

Back.name: One Arm Row (Underhand)
Back.desc:
Hypertrophy: 3-4 Sets / 8-10 Reps
Strength: 3-4 Sets / 4-6 Reps (Heavy)

1) Grab a dumbbell and place it next to the side of a bench

2) Place your left hand on the front of the bench and your left knee on the bench so that your back is straight

3) Pick up the dumbbell with an underhand grip in your right hand and pull the bumbell up and towards your mid back (not chest) and lower it back down

4) Do the opposite for the left side as well

5) Repeat

Back.name: One Arm Row
Back.desc:
Hypertrophy: 3-4 Sets / 8-10 Reps
Strength: 3-4 Sets / 4-6 Reps (Heavy)

1) Grab a dumbbell and place it next to the side of a bench

2) Place your left hand on the front of the bench and your left knee on the bench so that your back is straight

3) Pick up the dumbbell with your right hand and pull the bumbell up and towards your mid back (not chest) and lower it back down

4) Do the opposite for the left side as well

5) Repeat

Biceps.name: Preacher Curl
Biceps.desc:
Hypertrophy: 3-4 Sets / 10-12 Reps
Strength: 3-4 Sets / 4-6 Reps (Heavy)

1) Sit on preacher bench placing back of arms on pad

2) Grasp curl bar with shoulder width underhand grip

3) Raise bar until forearms are vertical

4) Lower barbell in a controlled manner until arms are fully extended

5) Repeat

Biceps.name: Preacher Curl (Dumbbell)
Biceps.desc:
Hypertrophy: 3-4 Sets / 10-12 Reps
Strength: 3-4 Sets / 4-6 Reps (Heavy)

1) Sit on preacher bench placing back of arms on pad

2) Grasp the dumbbell vertically in your right hand

3) Raise the dumbbell until forearm is vertical

4) Lower dumbbell in a controlled manner until your arm is fully extended

5) Repeat steps for your opposite arm

Biceps.name: Incline Curl
Biceps.desc:
Hypertrophy: 3-4 Sets / 10-12 Reps
Strength: 3-4 Sets / 4-6 Reps (Heavy)

1) Sit on an inclined bench at 45 - 60 degrees

2) While keeping your elbows tucked into your sides, angle your hands about 45 degrees from your body

3) Preform a curl motion in this position

4) Typically done with a lighter weight

5) Repeat

Biceps.name: Dumbbell Curl
Biceps.desc:
Hypertrophy: 3-4 Sets / 8-10 Reps
Strength: 3-4 Sets / 4-6 Reps (Heavy)

1) With an appropriate weight, grab the dumbbells with an underhand grip

2) Lift the dumbbells up to just under your shoulders

3) Lower the weight in a slow and controlled manner

4) Repeat

Note: Can do doth arms at the same time or alternate arms

Biceps.name: Hammer Curl
Biceps.desc:
Hypertrophy: 3-4 Sets / 8-10 Reps
Strength: 3-4 Sets / 4-6 Reps (Heavy)

1) With an appropriate weight, grab the dumbbells with a vertical grip

2) Lift the dumbbells up to just under your shoulders while crossing the dumbbell infront of your chest

3) Lower the weight in a slow and controlled manner

4) Repeat

Note:Can do doth arms at the same time or alternate arms

Biceps.name: Run the Rack
Biceps.desc:
1 Set / Reps (to failure)

1) Start at a heavier weighted dumbbell set (can perform only 8-10 reps)

2) Grab the dumbbells with an underhand grip

3) Lift the dumbbells up to just under your shoulders

3) Lower the weight in a slow and controlled manner

4) Once failure is reached, drop down to the next lightest dumbbell set available (drop by 10lbs if you started at 50lbs or higher)

5) Repeat until you reach 5lbs and stop

Note: Can do doth arms at the same time or alternate arms

Biceps.name: Barbell Curl
Biceps.desc:
Hypertrophy: 3-4 Sets / 8-10 Reps
Strength: 3-4 Sets / 4-6 Reps (Heavy)

1) Grab a barbell of an appropriate weight with an underhand grip

2) Lift the barbell up to just under your shoulders

3) Lower the weight in a slow controlled manner

4) Repeat

Biceps.name: Overhand Curl
Biceps.desc:
Hypertrophy: 3-4 Sets / 8-10 Reps
Strength: 3-4 Sets / 4-6 Reps (Heavy)

1) Grab a barbell of an appropriate weight with an overhand grip

2) Lift the barbell up to just under your shoulders

3) Lower the weight in a slow controlled manner

4) Repeat

Biceps.name: Twenty-Ones
Biceps.desc:
Hypertrophy: 3 Sets / 21 Reps

1) Grab a barbell of an appropriate weight with an underhand grip

2) For the first 7 reps (0-7), lift the barbell up so that your forearms are parallel to the floor

3) Lower the weight in a slow controlled manner

4) For the next 7 reps (8-14), starting with your forearms parallel to the ground, lift the barbell up to just under your shoulders

5) Lower the weight in a slow controlled manner

6) For the last 7 reps (15-21), starting with your arms extended down, lift the barbell up to just under your shoulders for a full range of motion

7) Lower the weight in a slow controlled manner

8) Repeat

Calves.name: Calf Raise
Calves.desc:
Hypertrophy: 3-4 Sets / 10-15 Reps
Strength: 3-4 Sets / 6-8 Reps (Heavy)

1) Position the shoulder rests at an appropriate height so that you have pressure on you when under it

2) With the heels of your feet hanging over the edge of the step, lift up on your tippy toes and slowly lower for a full extension

3) Repeat

Calves.name: Stair Calf Raise
Calves.desc:
1 Set / 10 Reps per step

1) Stand at the bottom of a staircase

2) At each step, do the specified amount of controlled reps with a full extension

Note: Hold onto the railing for support

Calves.name: Seated Calf Raise
Calves.desc:
Hypertrophy: 3-4 Sets / 10-15 Reps
Strength: 3-4 Sets / 6-8 Reps (Heavy)

1) Sit in the seat and position the pad over your knees so that there is pressure applied

2) Lift up and move the safty bar out of the way

3) Lift up on your tippy toes and slowly lower for a full extension

4) Repeat

Calves.name: Donkey Calf Raise
Calves.desc:
Hypertrophy: 3-4 Sets / 10-15 Reps
Strength: 3-4 Sets / 6-8 Reps (Heavy)

1) Sit in the seat and position the foot rest at an appropriate length so that there is pressure applied

2) Push the rest forward with your tippy toes for a full extension, then in a controlled manner return the foot rest back into its original resting point

3) Repeat

Chest.name: Bench Press (Dumbbell)
Chest.desc:
Hypertrophy: 3-4 Sets / 8-10 Reps
Strength: 3-4 Sets / 4-6 Reps (Heavy)

1) Sit on the edge of the bench with a set of dumbbells on your knees

2) With the help of your knees throw the weight up while you lay back on the bench

3) With your shoulders dug into the bench, arch your back and squeeze your glutes for maximum balance

4) Move your feet back so that your heels barely lift of the ground

5) Lower the weight so that you touch your chest before exploding the weight back to the top

6) Repeat

Chest.name: Bench Press
Chest.desc:
Hypertrophy: 3-4 Sets / 8-10 Reps
Strength: 3-4 Sets / 4-6 Reps (Heavy)

1) Lay down on a bench with a barbell above you

2) Position your body so the barbell rests between your eyes and your nose

3) With your shoulders dug into the bench, arch your back and squeeze your glutes for maximum balance

4) Move your feet back so that your heels barely lift of the ground

5) Grab the bar with an overhand grip, lift of the rack and in a controlled manner, lower the weight so that you touch your chest before exploding the weight back to the top

6) Repeat

Chest.name: Bench Press (Wide)
Chest.desc:
Hypertrophy: 3-4 Sets / 8-10 Reps
Strength: 3-4 Sets / 4-6 Reps (Heavy)

1) Lay down on a bench with a barbell above you

2) Position your body so the barbell rests between your eyes and your nose

3) With your shoulders dug into the bench, arch your back and squeeze your glutes for maximum balance

4) Move your feet back so that your heels barely lift of the ground

5) Grab the bar with a wide (past shoulder width apart) overhand grip, lift of the rack and in a controlled manner, lower the weight so that you touch your chest before exploding the weight back to the top

6) Repeat

Chest.name: Chest Flys (Dumbbell)
Chest.desc:
Hypertrophy: 3-4 Sets / 10-12 Reps
Strength: 3-4 Sets / 4-6 Reps (Heavy)

1) Position the bench at about a 45 degree angle

2) Grab a set of lighter dumbbells and sit down on the bench with the dumbbells resting on your knees

3) Throw the weights up and lay back on the bench with the weight straight up infront of you

4) Push the handles back out infront of you to complete the rep

5) Repeat

Chest.name: Chest Flys
Chest.desc:
Hypertrophy: 3-4 Sets / 10-12 Reps
Strength: 3-4 Sets / 4-6 Reps (Heavy)

1) Position the seat at a height so that the handles are at chest level

2) Grab onto the handles one at a time and position them infront of you

3) In a controlled manner allow the weight to fall back into its starting position to create a stretch in the muscle

4) Push the handles back out infront of you to complete the rep

5) Repeat

Chest.name: Cable Flys
Chest.desc:
Hypertrophy: 3-4 Sets / 10-12 Reps
Strength: 3-4 Sets / 4-6 Reps (Heavy)

1) Position the cables at a height so that the handles are above your shoulders

2) Grab onto the handles one at a time and step forward while pulling on the cables to position them infront of you

3) In a controlled manner allow the weight to fall back into its starting position to create a stretch in the muscle

4) Push the handles back out infront of you to complete the rep

5) Repeat

Chest.name: Incline Dumbbell Press
Chest.desc:
Hypertrophy: 3-4 Sets / 10-12 Reps
Strength: 3-4 Sets / 4-6 Reps (Heavy)

1) Lay down on the bench and using your knees lift the weight up. With your elbows pointed at about 45 degree angles from your body, in a controlled manner lower the dumbbells down to your chest level and then explode the weight back up. Repeat.

Chest.name: Incline Bench Press
Chest.desc:
Hypertrophy: 3-4 Sets / 8-10 Reps
Strength: 3-4 Sets / 4-6 Reps (Heavy)

1) Lay down on the bench

2) With your shoulders dug into the bench, arch your back and squeeze your glutes for maximum balance

3) In a controlled manner lower the barbell down to your upper chest and then explode the weight back up4) Repeat

Chest.name: Push-ups (Knees)
Chest.desc:
4-5 Sets / 10-15 Reps

1) Position yourself on the floor with your knees together on the ground and your hands at your chest but shoulder width apart

2) While keeping your back straight, push yourself off the ground with your knees on the ground and palms of your hands

3) Lower yourself so that your nose almost touches the ground

4) Do not allow yourself to fall to the ground

5) Repeat

Chest.name: Push-ups
Chest.desc:
4-5 Sets / 10-15 Reps

1) Position yourself on the floor with your legs straight back and your hands at your chest but shoulder width apart

2) While keeping your back straight, push yourself off the ground with your tippy toes and palms of your hands on the ground still

3) Lower yourself so that your nose almost touches the ground

4) Do not allow yourself to fall to the ground

5) Repeat

Chest.name: Push-ups (Diamond)
Chest.desc:
4-5 Sets / 10-15 Reps

1) Position yourself on the floor with your legs straight back and your hands at chest level in a diamond formation

2) While keeping your back straight, push yourself off the ground with your tippy toes and palms of your hands on the ground still

3) Lower yourself so that your nose almost touches the ground

4) Do not allow yourself to fall to the ground

5) Repeat

Chest.name: Plate Pushaways
Chest.desc:
4-5 Sets / 10-15 Reps

1) Grab a plate of appropriate weight, Hold the weight close to your chest with both hands pressing against the flat sides of the plate in an upright position

2) Push against the plate with as much pressure as you can and slowly extend your arms to push the plate out infront of you

3) Slowly bring the plate back towards your chest while continuing to apply pressure

4) Repeat

Core.name: Leg Raises
Core.desc:
4-5 Sets / 10-12 Reps

1) Lay down on the floor with your legs flat out infront of you

2) Lift your legs slightly off the ground so that your core is engaged

3) Lift your legs up as close to 90 degrees as you can while trying to keep you legs as straight as possible

4) Lower your legs down slowly to your starting position

5) Repeat

Core.name: V-Ups
Core.desc:
4-5 Sets / 10-12 Reps

1) Lay down on the floor with your legs flat out infront of you

2) Lift your legs off the ground at about a 45-60 degree angle

3) Lift yourself up off the ground and try to touch your toes

4) Keep your legs as straight as possible

4) Lower your torso down slowly to your starting position

5) Repeat

Core.name: Hanging Leg Raises
Core.desc:
4-5 Sets / 8-10 Reps

1) Grab a pull up bar with an overhnd grip

2) Lift your legs slightly off the ground so that you are hanging from the bar

3) Lift your legs up infront of you as high as you can while trying to keep you legs as straight as possible

4) Lower your legs down slowly to your starting position

5) Repeat

Core.name: Exercise Ball Crunches
Core.desc:
4-5 Sets / 10-15 Reps

1) Grab an exercise ball of an appropriate height so that your knees bend at a 90 degree angle when sitting on it

2) Cross your arms in front of you or hold your hands at the side of your head

3) Using your core, lift your torso up off the ball so you are almost sitting up on the ball

4) Lower yourself back onto the ball slowly

5) Repeat

Core.name: Crunches
Core.desc:
4-5 Sets / 10-15 Reps

1) Lay down on the floor with your legs bent at a 90 degree angle

2) Either cross your arms in front of you or hold your hands at the side of your head

3) Using your core, lift your body up off the ground while keeping your lower body on the ground

4) Lower yourself back onto the ground slowly

5) Repeat

Core.name: Sit-Ups
Core.desc:
4-5 Sets / 10-15 Reps

1) Lay down on the floor with your legs bent at a 90 degree angle

2) Either cross your arms in front of you or hold your hands at the side of your head

3) Using your core, lift your body up off the ground so you are sitting up

4) Lower yourself back onto the ground slowly

5) Repeat

Core.name: Russian Twist
Core.desc:
4-5 Sets / 10-15 Reps

1) Sit down on the ground so that you are balancing on just your butt

2) Holding a weight (Medicine Ball, dumbbell, Plate, etc.), move the weight to one side of your body by only rotating your torso

3) Move the weight across your body to the other side by rotating your torso back the other way

4) Remain balanced on your butt the entire movement

5) Repeat

Core.name: Bicycle Kicks
Core.desc:
4-5 Sets / 10-15 Reps

1) Sit down on the ground so that you are balancing on just your butt

2) Place your hands on the side of your head

3) Tuck your left knee in and touch it with your right elbow to cause a twisting motion

4) Your right leg should still be straight out infront of you

5) Alternate to the opposite elbow and knee to complete one rep

6) Remain balanced on your butt the entire movement

7) Repeat

Forearms.name: Forearm Curl (Dumbbell)
Forearms.desc:
3-4 Sets / 10-12 Reps

1) Grab a dumbbell and sit on the end of a bench

2) Lean over and rest your arm on your leg so that your hand is hanging just over your knee

3) Use your wrist to curl the weight up and back down in a controlled manner

4) Repeat movement for opposite arm

Forearms.name: Forearm Curl
Forearms.desc:
3-4 Sets / 10-12 Reps

1) Grab a barbell and sit on the end of a bench

2) Lean over and rest your arms on your legs so that your hands are hanging just over your knees

3) Use your wrists to curl the weight up and back down in a controlled manner

4) Repeat

Forearms.name: Dumbbell Hold
Forearms.desc:
3-4 Sets / 45 seconds - 1 minute

1) Grab a set of heavier dumbbells and hold them in your hands

2) While squeezing the grips as hard as you can, hold the dumbbells at your sides

3) Do not let the weight rest against your body

4) Hold the weight for the recommended time

5) Repeat

Hamstrings.name: Romanian Deadlift (Dumbbell)
Hamstrings.desc:
Hypertrophy: 3-4 Sets / 8-10 Reps
Strength: 3-4 Sets / 4-6 Reps (Heavy)

1) Grab a set of dumbbells and set them in front of you on their sides

2) With your feet together, pick up the weight and stand up straight to start the motion

3) While hinging back at your hips, lower the weight to just past your knees while keeping the weight as close to your body as possible

4) Keep your back and legs straight throught the movement

5) Pull the weight back up

6) Repeat

Hamstrings.name: Romanian Deadlift
Hamstrings.desc:
Hypertrophy: 3-4 Sets / 8-10 Reps
Strength: 3-4 Sets / 4-6 Reps (Heavy)

1) Grab a barbell and set it in front of you

2) With your feet together, pick up the weight and stand up straight to start the motion

3) While hinging back at your hips, lower the weight to just past your knees while keeping the weight as close to your body as possible

4) Keep your back and legs straight throught the movement

5) Pull the weight back up

6) Repeat

Hamstrings.name: Hamstring Curls (Seated)
Hamstrings.desc:
Hypertrophy: 3-4 Sets / 8-10 Reps
Strength: 3-4 Sets / 4-6 Reps (Heavy)

1) Adjust the arm to the appropriate distance so that your ankles rest against it when sitting down

2) Sit down on the seat so that your knees are positioned just passed the edge

3) Pull the arm down so your knees are in a 90 degree angle

4) Raise the arm slowly back in to its original position

5) Repeat

Hamstrings.name: Hamstring Curls
Hamstrings.desc: Adjust the arm to the appropriate distance so that your ankles rest against it when lying down. Lay down on the bench so that your knees are positioned at the very edge. Pull the arm up and as close to your butt as possible without bouncing it off of yourself. Lower the arm slowly back in to its original position. Repeat.

Hamstrings.name: Lunges
Hamstrings.desc:
3-4 Sets / 8-10 Reps

1) Lunge forward with your right foot so that your left knee is barely off the ground

2) Push back up into your starting position

3) Do the same for the left leg to complete one rep

4) Repeat

Hamstrings.name: Lunge Pass Through
Hamstrings.desc: Grab a kettlebell and stand up straight. Lunge forward with your right foot so that your left knee is barely off the ground. Pass the kettlebell under your right leg from one hand to the other. Push back up into your starting position. Do the same for the left leg. Repeat

Shoulders.name: Seated Overhead Press
Shoulders.desc:
Hypertrophy: 3-4 Sets / 8-10 Reps
Strength: 3-4 Sets / 4-6 Reps (Heavy)

1) At an upright bench with a barbell holder over it, position the barbell so that its at a comfortable height above your shoulders

2) Grab the barbell with an overhand grip about shoulder length apart

3) Lower the bar so that it rests just above your neck

4) Raise the bar back in to its starting point

5) Repeat

Shoulders.name: Overhead Press
Shoulders.desc:
Hypertrophy: 3-4 Sets / 8-10 Reps
Strength: 3-4 Sets / 4-6 Reps (Heavy)

1) At a squat rack position the barbell so that its at shoulder height

2) Grab the barbell with an overhand grip about shoulder length apart

3) Position your body under the bar so that the barbell rests just below your neck

4) Lift the barbell off the rack and take a step back

5) While keeping your body straight and tight, move your head out of the path of the bar and lift the bar up above your head

6) Lower the weight back onto its starting point

7) Repeat

Shoulders.name: One Arm Dumbbell Shoulder Press
Shoulders.desc:
3-4 Sets / 8-10 Reps

1) Grab a dumbbell of an appropriate weight

2) Sit on an upright bench and hold the dumbbell on your knee

3) Using your knee and other hand, lift the weight up abvoe your head

4) Lower the weight back down to shoulder level in a controlled manner while keeping your arms at avbout a 45 degree angle from your body

5) Do not arch your back during this motion

6) Repeat

Shoulders.name: Dumbbell Shoulder Press
Shoulders.desc:
Hypertrophy: 3-4 Sets / 8-10 Reps
Strength: 3-4 Sets / 4-6 Reps (Heavy)

1) Grab a set of dumbbells of an appropriate weightànàn2) Sit on an upright bench and hold the dumbbells on your knees

3) Using your knees, lift the weight up

4) Push the weight up over your head

5) Lower the weight back down to shoulder level in a controlled manner while keeping your arms at avbout a 45 degree angle from your body

6) Do not arch your back during this motion

7) Repeat

Shoulders.name: Lateral Raise
Shoulders.desc:
3-4 Sets / 10-12 Reps

1) Grab a set of dumbbells of a lighter weight

2) Stand up straight with the dumbbells at your sides

3) While keeping your arms as straight as possible, raise the dumbbells up to shoulder height

4) It should feel like you are pulling from your elbows as to not allow the weight to go higher than your shoulders

5) Lower the weight back down slowly

6) Repeat

Shoulders.name: Front Delt Raise
Shoulders.desc:
3-4 Sets / 10-12 Reps

1) Grab a set of dumbbells of a lighter weight

2) Stand up straight with the dumbbells in front of you

3) While keeping your arms as straight as possible, raise the dumbbells up to shoulder height infront of you

4) Do not allow the weight to go higher than your shoulders

5) Lower the weight back down slowly to complete the motion

6) Repeat.

Traps.name: Shoulder Shrugs (Dumbbell)
Traps.desc:
3-4 Sets / 10-12 Reps

1) Grab a set of dumbbells of an appropriate weight

2) While keeping your head straight and your shoulders back, Shrug your shoulders to pull the weight up

3) Hold for a couple seconds then slowly lower the weight back down

4) Repeat

Traps.name: Shoulder Shrugs (Barbell)
Traps.desc:
3-4 Sets / 10-12 Reps

1) Grab a barbell of an appropriate weight

2) While keeping your head straight and your shoulders back, Shrug your shoulders to pull the weight up

3) Hold for a couple seconds then slowly lower the weight back down

4) Repeat

Traps.name: Face Pulls
Traps.desc:
3-4 Sets / 10-12 Reps

1) Hook up the rope handles on a cable that is positioned above your head

2) Select an appropriate weight so that you can stand away from the cable and lean back without falling down

3) Pull the rope towards your face and hold it for a few seconds before slowly letting it go back into its starting position

4) Repeat

Triceps.name: Tricep Kick Backs
Triceps.desc:
3-4 Sets / 10-12 Reps

1) Grab a light dumbbell

2) Lean over and rest your arm on an upright bench

3) With the weight in the opposite arm, position your arm straight back behind you

4) Extend the arm so that it is straight

5) Lower the weight back down hinging at the elbow

6) Repeat

Triceps.name: Tricep Pushdowns
Triceps.desc:
Hypertrophy: 3-4 Sets / 8-10 Reps
Strength: 3-4 Sets / 4-6 Reps (Heavy)

1) Grab the rope attachment and hook it up to the cable machine so that it is positioned higher than your shoulders

2) Grab each end of the rope one in each hand

3) Position yourself so your butt is out and your chest is up

4) While keeping your elbows tucked in to your sides, pull the rope down into a full extension

5) Slowly return the attachment to it's starting position

6) Repeat

Note: Can be done with a bar attachment as well

Triceps.name: Skull Crushers (Dumbbells)
Triceps.desc:
Grab a set of dumbbells and sit on the edge of a bench

2) Lay down so that your shouler blades are tucked into the bench

3) With the dumbbells straight up above you lower your arms back so the weight is not directly above you

4) Hinging at the elbows, lower the weight towards your face without hitting it

5) Raise the weight back up to its starting position

6) Repeat

Triceps.name: Skull Crushers
Triceps.desc: Grab a barbell with an overhand grip and sit on the edge of a bench. Lay down so that your shouler blades are tucked into the bench. With the barbell straight up above you lower your arms back so the weight is not directly above you. Hinging at the elbows, lower the weight towards your face without hitting it. Raise the weight back up to its starting position. Repeat.

Triceps.name: Guillotine
Triceps.desc:
3-4 Sets / 8-10 Reps

1) Lay down on a bench with a barbell above you

2) Position your body so the barbell rests between your eyes and your nose

3) With your shoulders dug into the bench, arch your back and squeeze your glutes for maximum balance

4) Move your feet back so that your heels barely lift of the ground

5) Grab the bar with an overhand grip, lift of the rack and in a controlled manner, lower the weight towards the bottom of your chest without touching it

6) Hinge at your elbows to lower the bar towards your neck

7) Raise the bar back in to it's starting position to complete the movement

8) Repeat

Triceps.name: Close Grip Bench Press
Triceps.desc: Sit down on a bench with a barbell above it. Lay down so that the barbell is in between your eyes and nose. Tuckn your shoulders into the bench for support. Grab the barbell with an overhand grip inside of your shoulder width. Lift off the rests and lower the barbell down towards your chest. Keep your elbows as close to your body as possible throughout the entire movement. Once you touch your chest, explode the weight back to its starting position. Repeat.

Quads.name: Goblet Squats
Quads.desc:
Hypertrophy: 3-4 Sets / 8-10 Reps
Strength: 3-4 Sets / 4-6 Reps (Heavy)

1) Grab a dumbbell of an appropriate weight

2) Hold the flat part of the dumbbell with the palms of both of your hands

3) With the weight positioned infront of you, squat down so your butt goes below your knees

4) Keeping the pressure on your heels, explode back up into a full extension

5) Repeat

Quads.name: Squats
Quads.desc:
Hypertrophy: 3-4 Sets / 8-10 Reps
Strength: 3-4 Sets / 4-6 Reps (Heavy)

1) Stand in front of the squat rack with the barbell positioned at your shoulder height

2) Grab the barbell with a wide overhand grip

3) Move underneath the barbell so that it rests on your traps comfortably

4) Lift the weight off the rack and take a step back

5) Standing with your feet about shoulder width apart, Begin decsending by hinging back at your hips and dropping your butt so that you go past having your quads parallel to the floor

6) Explode back up to the top of the motion

7) Repeat

Quads.name: Front Squats
Quads.desc:
Hypertrophy: 3-4 Sets / 8-10 Reps
Strength: 3-4 Sets / 4-6 Reps (Heavy)

1) Stand in front of the squat rack with the barbell positioned at your shoulder height

2) Rest the barbell on your collar bone with either your arms crossed or an underhand grip

3) Move underneath the barbell so that it rests on your traps comfortably

4) Lift the weight off the rack and take a step back

5) Standing with your feet about shoulder width apart, Begin decsending by hinging back at your hips and dropping your butt so that you go past having your quads parallel to the floor

6) Explode back up to the top of the motion

7) Repeat

Quads.name: Single Leg Press
Quads.desc:
Hypertrophy: 3-4 Sets / 8-10 Reps
Strength: 3-4 Sets / 4-6 Reps (Heavy)

1) Sit down on the seat and place one foot up on the platform so it is inline with your shoulder

2) Push the weight up off the rack and remove the safety bars

3) Lower the weight down so your knee almost touch your chest

4) Push the weight back up but do not lock out at your knee

5) Repeat this movement in a smooth continuous motion for maximum engagement

Quads.name: Leg Press
Quads.desc:
Hypertrophy: 3-4 Sets / 8-10 Reps
Strength: 3-4 Sets / 4-6 Reps (Heavy)

1) Sit down on the seat and place your feet up on the platform about shoulder width apart

2) Push the weight up off the rack and remove the safety bars

3) Lower the weight down so your knees almost touch your chest

4) Push the weight back up but do not lock out at your knees

5) Repeat this movement in a smooth continuous motion for maximum engagement.

Quads.name: Leg Extension
Quads.desc:
Hypertrophy: 3-4 Sets / 8-10 Reps
Strength: 3-4 Sets / 4-6 Reps (Heavy)

1) Sit on the seat and position the arm so that it rests comfortably on the bottom of your shins

2) Holding onto the handles, raise your legs to a full extension and hold for a couple seconds

3) Slowly lower the weight back down to the arm is back in its starting poisition

4) Repeat
